replies.bodyText: If this is a single name, why is this a list?
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: This is a List<StringRenderable> that acts as a name for this gamerule widget. I think it might also contain the description of the gamerule? @liach
replies.author: phase

replies.bodyText: I don't know why name is a list, phase might be right in that it also contains the description.
replies.author: Shnupbups

replies.bodyText: Maybe they do the line wrapping logic before building the widget? I guess.

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_5398 net/minecraft/entity/ai/goal/UniversalAngerGoal
+	FIELD field_25604 entityType Lnet/minecraft/class_1308;
+	FIELD field_25605 angerOthers Z

replies.bodyText: Universal anger, per the gamerule, means that an angry mob will be angry at every player rather than just the one that attacked them. It does not mean that every mob will be angry. This method is used for mobs that attack in groups (bees, wolves, zombie piglins) to notify others in range to get mad (at no one in particular, just get mad).
replies.author: Shnupbups

timeline.bodyText: main world or overworld? should only be overworld if the dimension id is minecraft:overworld. If this is worlds[0] then should be main world.
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Pretty sure it specifically refers to the overworld.
replies.author: Shnupbups

replies.bodyText: This method uses the RegistryKey for the Overworld specifically, so getOverworld is a good name 👍 @liach

timeline.author: phase

replies.bodyText: Maybe just ANGER_DURATION or ANGER_TIME since this type is already a range.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Problem is ANGER_TIME already exists for the Wolf's actual current anger time. I'll just go with ANGER_TIME_RANGE I guess
replies.author: Shnupbups

timeline.author: phase

replies.bodyText: Don't think wiki.vg is that reliable on new contents. For example, you can see that mojang writes registry to a compound tag from code while wiki.vg was initially broken by the dfu codec registry update
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Fyi wiki.vg's license is cc0 sharealike while yarn is cc0 (no sharealike). As a result, you cannot use wiki.vg's content as your evidence/reason for naming a member.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: If this is the case, we should amend our contributing.md to explicitly prohibit use of wiki.vg for reference
replies.author: i509VCB

timeline.bodyText: This renders the name of the rule on the left side of the screen. Not actually a render method. The widgets are rendered by implementations of the NamedRuleWidget
timeline.author: i509VCB
